programme.title: Lamput
programme.desc: The Docs run out of puff and decide to cut some corners. All it takes is a sharpie, as it happens; just change a wanted poster to offer a huge reward, and bingo! The public are gonna do your work for you. Weirdly quickly, a hard-boiled granny shows up with Lamput under her arm. Things turn ugly when she actually expects to be paid the reward. Most unreasonable. Not even an odd-jobs montage can pay this giant bill; the Docs get desperate and turn to crime, which works about as well for them as it usually does. Specs and Skinny end up in the clink, the granny pockets a heap of cash, and Lamput is yet again the one that got away.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Bean wants to avoid lunch with Irma’s Mum at all costs. He persuades Mrs. Wicket to let him join her on a coach trip to a concert.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr. Bean climbs into his favourite tree to stop it from being chopped down.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean has to replace his landlady’s cat after an unfortunate ‘accident’.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean builds a supermarket super trolley.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: When Scrapper claws a rip in Teddy, Mr Bean rushes him to the Teddy hospital. As Teddy is being fixed, Mr Bean is rather taken with another Ted on sale in the shop. He decided to take Big Ted home with him once Teddy is fixed. But at home it seems as though Big Ted is freezing Teddy out, and after a particularly terrifying nightmare, Mr Bean realises he has to get rid of his new guest.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mrs. Wicket is persuaded by a jaunty estate agent to put her house up for sale. Bean is distraught – where will he live? Not Mrs. Wicket’s problem.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr. Bean tries to learn skateboarding but hurts himself.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mrs Wicket becomes inconsolable when Scrapper goes missing. Mr Bean investigates.

programme.title: Lamput
programme.desc: Its a night out at the theatre for the Docs but when they spot Lamput in the front row, they decide to give up their night of culture for a night of capture! Lamput escapes backstage where he morphs from scenery into props, then into costume and eventually ends up on stage! The Docs make chase, and end up becoming part of the performance too, much to the Directors dismay. Can the show go on? Or will it be a total flop?

programme.title: Lamput
programme.desc: The Boss shows he’s still got it in the inventin’ department by coming up with a brain-swapping raygun. Just what the world needs. The Boss’ glory is short lived, though, when the raygun starts going off randomly. The Boss and Lamput trade places, and we get to see what it looks like when the worst boss in the world can also freak you out by morphing into orange stuff. Everyone’s acting topsy turvy, so it’s up to Specs and Skinny to straighten things out. Lucky those guys don’t have brains to swap.

programme.title: Lamput
programme.desc: The Docs spot Lamput in the audience of a magic show and try to catch him. The chase takes them backstage where Lamput evades the Docs with the help of different magic contraptions until Specs and Skinny unknowingly ends up on stage. They become reluctant assistants to the Magician who is about to perform some death-defying tricks – with the help of the Docs!

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders
programme.desc: It’s Taz’s birthday, so The Looney Builders build him a huge ice cream sundae.

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders
programme.desc: The Looney Builders race against the clock to build Cecil Turtle a new racetrack.

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders: Hard Hat Time
programme.desc: A music video of Lola Bunny using her bulldozer to move things as she oversees various looney builds.

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: Everyone is ecstatic when Bibi, Batgirl, and Robin capture Toyman and his Do-Over remote - except for Bibi, who failed to stick the landing on a big jump. Unwilling to accept her failure, Bibi uses Toymans Do-Over remote until she perfects her jump!

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: When Bam is sent out to take on Prank, Redbird asks to join the fight, but Bam insists he hangs back - that Vans too dangerous!

programme.title: Be Cool, Scooby-Doo!
programme.desc: The gang is honored to take part in the wedding of two close friends. But can Best Man Shaggy and Maid of Honor Daphne save their friend’s perfect day before it’s ruined by a tragic Ghost Bride bent on destroying everyone else’s happily ever after?

programme.title: Be Cool, Scooby-Doo!
programme.desc: A legendary criminal returns on a Day of the Dead festival.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean loses a stranger’s engagement ring and has to get it back in time for the proposal!

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean and Teddy are enjoying a day at the arcade, when Mr Bean gets carried away with the dance machine, knocking Teddy onto the floor. Teddy’s picked up, put on a trolley of stuffed toys and figurines – and soon enough, he’s been put in the claw machine as a prize! Mr Bean has run out of coins, so has to find a way of winning Teddy back without looking like he’s cheating!

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean and Teddy are looking forward to seeing a once-in-a-lifetime comet – but it won’t appear until 4am! He tries to stay up, but it’s useless – he keeps dropping off. So instead, Mr Bean decides to go to bed and set an alarm – yet he over-winds the clock and it breaks! With all the shops closed, his only option is to build his own complicated version to make sure he doesn’t miss the comet…

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mrs Wicket makes Mr Bean drive her to the hospital to get her ingrown toenail seen to and asks him to wait. Mr Bean gets bored, and on a wander around the hospital he finds a spare doctor’s outfit with stethoscope – great Teddy - I’ll give you a check-up! But a nurse spots him, and thinking he’s a new doctor Mr Bean is asked to visit patients. How long can he keep it up before he’s found out?

programme.title: Lamput
programme.desc: Lamput gets mistaken for a guide dog, and the Docs try to nab their quarry without disturbing an old ladys pleasant day in front of the wireless. Good thing she cant see the chaos going on.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: The Lemmings find a mask that terrifies anyone who looks at it.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: The Lemmings lay hands on an ancient console, and Grizzy is transported into the game.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: A snowstorm rips the solar panels off the log cabin and Grizzy can no longer watch TV or enjoy the comforts of home! But he has a brilliant idea. He produces electricity by making a caribou run on a treadmill, using the last carrot in the house as bait. But the Lemmings absolutely want his carrot to make the perfect snowman.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: Grizzy discovers in shock that the TV has been replaced with a trompe-l’oeil image. Furious, he flushes the Lemmings out of their hiding place where they’d hoped to watch their favorite cartoon in peace and propels them as far as possible. They land in an ancient cave where a powerful spirit capable of entering individuals is asleep. The Lemmings decide to free the spirit and send it to Grizzy. But will they be able to control the spirit?

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: Not easy to enjoy a DVD about salmon when the Lemmings are having a disco party right there. Grizzy sends them packing with such force that they land at the research station, where they discover a state-of-the-art U.V. cabin. When turned up to the max, the light therapy and music options can advantageously replace the disco equipment Grizzy destroyed. The noise they make causes a block of ice to break off. It hurdles down the slope to the cabin and destroys Grizzy’s TV. But it doesn’t take the bear long to figure out that the U.V. cabin also has a DVD function.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: The Lemmings have fun destroying ice towers. When Grizzy sees them, it inspires him to sculpt statues of himself. The Lemmings cannot resist the temptation to destroy the statues of Grizzy, who does everything in his power to protect them.

programme.title: SuperThings: Rivals of Kaboom - Kazoom Power
programme.desc: The Kazoom Kids must awaken the SuperThings from a thousand-year sleep induced by Zzleeper.

programme.title: Be Cool, Scooby-Doo!
programme.desc: Fred gets a call for help from Chuck, his daredevil of a best friend, leading the gang on a rescue mission deep in the caverns of an ancient civilization.

programme.title: Be Cool, Scooby-Doo!
programme.desc: Its Scoobys dream come true as the gang visits the set of his favorite TV show and he meets the star, his celebrity crush, a dog actress who plays a detective on the screen. Now all Scooby has to do is work up the courage to actually talk to her while also solving the mystery of the monstrous Gargoyle attacking the production!

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean loses a stranger’s engagement ring and has to get it back in time for the proposal!

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean is wracked with guilt after he chases Scrapper and ends up with a flattened cat.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean plays gooseberry when Mrs Wicket falls in love with a man Mr Bean doesn’t trust.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: During a visit to Buckingham Palace Mr Bean meets the lady of the house.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: The Lemmings have fun bouncing off the backs of harmless green frogs while Grizzy chases some mosquitos buzzing around him in vain.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: The Lemmings improvise a trampoline with bagpipes, only each jump is accompanied by a deafening outburst. Grizzy steps in and hurls the object far from the castle.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: The Lemmings organize an obstacle course in their cabin. Grizzy ejects the Lemmings from the cabin and they crash onto an Incan temple where they discover a spheric object that can control the Earths rotation.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: The Lemmings get hold of an old pinball machine and install it in the cabin. Their furious party interrupts Grizzys nap and the bear threatens to break the contraption.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: Grizzy, a big chocolate lover, is growing a young cacao tree under an ultraviolet lamp. During a trampoline session, the Lemmings accidentally break the lamp, provoking a supernatural reaction.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: During a fight, Grizzy and the Lemmings stumble upon a Mayan temple lost in the jungle. Once inside, they set off a magic reaction that creates doubles of themselves at different ages. They now have a Grizzy babe and elderly Lemmings. Grizzy tries to get the young bear interested in a documentary on salmon, while the Lemmings want to initiate their ancestors to dance. But age differences are not so easily defeated.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: Short on food supplies, Grizzy has gone out to gather fruit. He comes back with a basketful but discovers that the Lemmings have stolen the last of the chocolate spread.

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: The Legion of Zoom is tired of always losing. They decide to take a page from the Batwheels and try using teamwork in order to pull off a daring heist. But will they be able to work together?

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: Redbird sacrifices his stealth muffler tech to sound as loud as the other Batwheels but his modifications backfire when Robin needs his stealthy skills to catch the elusive Catwoman!

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: When Batcomputer shuts down for a system update, the other Batwheels must take over for her while aiding Batman in a battle against Harley Quinn.

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: MOE wants to know what its like to be a member of the Batwheels, but the bot gets more than he bargained for when Bam invites him along for an exciting mission to stop Poison Ivy.

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders
programme.desc: The Easter Bunny is sick, so she hires The Looney Builders to take over the festivities and ensure Looneyburg has a great Easter.

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders
programme.desc: The Looney Builders are hired by Ma and Pa Bear to build a bedroom for their son, Junior, whose excitement causes setbacks.

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders
programme.desc: When The Looney Builders help Wile E. Coyote build a telescope to view the Looney Moon, Tweety must face his fear of the dark. / The Looney Builders are hired by Mayor Leghorn to build the venue for the Looney Games. They soon become overwhelmed by the job and must ask for help.

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders
programme.desc: Gossamer extends a camping trip invitation to the Looney Builders; their plans for a basic campsite shift when Daffy convinces the group to experience glamping instead.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: When Hildie receives another dozen black roses from a secret admirer, her curiosity is piqued. Sending Tom and Jerry to find out the identity of the mystery admirer, they end up at the Enchanted Flower Shop across the forest, where they encounter some frightful arrangements and a few "dead ends."

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: After yet another unsuccessful attempt to catch Jerry, Tom falls under the influence of a traveling cat salesman named Carver, who sells him a series of elaborate mousetraps, tricks and schemes. Setting out to dish up a "world of hurt" on Jerry, Tom only managed to injure himself.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Rick has taken up painting to help him relax.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Unable to sleep because of the incessant barking from a dog somewhere in the city, Tom and Jerry must track down the noisy mutt. When they find the dog with the help of a friendly bat, they discover the pup cant sleep without her special pillow. Now, for the sake of everyones sleep, the great pillow case is on!

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: After Rick and Ginger install a high-tech, state-of-the-art home security system, Tom and Jerrys shenanigans activate the homes automation system. Using the system against each other, they quickly lose control and the house shuts them down.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Ginger accidentally backs her car over Butchs tail. Feeling awful, she brings the alley cat into her home until hes feeling better. Butch is finally getting what hes wanted, much to Toms chagrin, especially now that Gingers having him take care of the poor injured cat. Jerry revels in the situation until he realizes that two idiot cats are more trouble than one and Jerrys getting his butt whooped. Now Jerry must prove that Butch is rehabilitated in order to return him to the alley where he belongs and return his life.

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: The gang is playing tag the Meteoroid when Glitch fails to follow Slippys instruction. He soon realises its because Glitch saw the comet hes been tracking for months!

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: Ella and Slippy are perfecting their triple corkscrews when Priya, Ella’s best friend from Earth, surprises her with a visit. Priya performs a perfect triple corkscrew to everyone’s amazement. Ella is frustrated that she still can’t seem to nail it.

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: While playing ice hockey on Europa, an ice-covered moon of Jupiter, a stray puck hits Ella’s wrist and injures Maggie. Dad is sure he can fix her but will need palladium so he can fuse her fried circuits back together before she loses her memory.

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: Slippy wants to watch an eclipse so badly that he makes special safety goggles for himself and his friends. But Ella has a different plan. When she insists on going to watch a binary star supernova, Slippy opts out and heads off on his own.

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: Ella always looks forward to Momella Day. And this Momella day promises to be the most interstellar yet, because they are going to see a small but powerful Red Dwarf star!

programme.title: Toad And Friends
programme.desc: Mole is making his winter supply of jam, but its Portlys birthday, and Mole very generously gives everyone a jar of jam to give to Portly for a birthday present. Soon he has none left for winter. And Portly has rather a lot of jam!

programme.title: Toad And Friends
programme.desc: Its the Midsummer Festival, and everyone is contributing to it, with Badger as the master of ceremonies, the Jack of the Green. But when he finds himself trapped in his own home, how can the festival start?

programme.title: Toad And Friends
programme.desc: Everyone is too busy to play with Toad so he foolishly opens the lock gates in order to propel his new boat. But this creates a giant wave that demolishes the Otters’ holt downstream. Toad must now repair their home, finding help from an unexpected quarter.

programme.title: Toad And Friends
programme.desc: Toad installs a new Mauss security system to protect Toad Hall from the weasels, but Toads arrogance and rudeness towards Mauss leaves Toad locked out of Toad Hall for good. Only a big, mouse-sized apology can put things right.

programme.title: Toad And Friends
programme.desc: Toad shows off his new hammock but refuses to let anyone else have a nap in it. The weasels trap Toad in the hammock, leaving Toad Hall wide open for them. Can Toad’s friends use the hammock to regain Toad Hall?

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr. Bean becomes obsessed with gaming after being introduced by Mrs. Wickets nephew. He decides he must have his own console!.

programme.desc: Mrs. Wicket demands that Bean stay in to take delivery of a new lounge chair.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr. Bean is charged with keeping an eye on Irmas dog Mopsy, but Mopsy is a very wilful pooch! Who is really in charge of who?

programme.title: Black Pop: Celebrating the Power Of Black Culture
programme.desc: Black music has always been the heartbeat of America. However, its significance extends beyond dope beats and fun rhymes as it links to a rich history and tells a story of freedom. From the soulful era of Motown to the artistry of pop star royalty and more than 50 years of hip-hop, this episode explores how Black music shapes culture globally and tells the entire story of Black America’s hope, triumphs and unity.

programme.title: Black Pop: Celebrating the Power Of Black Culture
programme.desc: Although the impact of the Black experience on TV is undeniable, it took a beat to get there. This episode looks at that journey through the comedy gold in classics such as “Good Times” and “The Fresh Prince of Bel-Air,” the brilliance of “Living Single,” “Scandal,” “Insecure,” “Pose” and the modern-day laughs of “Abbott Elementary.” It’s a joyful celebration of Black America’s unapologetic presence on the small screen and the road to authentic representation.

programme.desc: Low orbit is only 120 miles above Earth, but this is where most of space exploration has occurred.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: During World War II, rumours spread that an aircraft had been built from extraterrestrial blueprints. Were aliens helping Hitlers quest for world domination?

programme.title: Secret History Of Humans
programme.desc: Five thousand years ago man throws a handful of rocks into a campfire and stumbles upon a discovery that changes the world: Metal. Copper, Tin and Bronze empower the ancient world and allow empires to expand, armed with sharp, hard-wearing weapons.

programme.title: Secret History Of Humans
programme.desc: Early man rubbed two sticks together and created fire. We learn to cook our food, saving vital energy. As a result, our brains expand. Armed with fire, we experiment by heating minerals to make tools allowing us to fight wars and build civilizations.

programme.title: Cities Of The Underworld
programme.desc: Chicago may be the third largest city in the USA, but it was a city built on shady dealings. Discover how it was a playground for mobsters.

programme.title: Gold Hunters: Legend Of The Superstition Mountains
programme.desc: A 200 year old treasure map leads Wayne and the team to a mysterious stone shaped like a heart with an X carved into its face; an investigation there leads to an unexpected discovery.

programme.title: Lost Gold Of World War II
programme.desc: Left with no other option, John plans to drill across the mountain to get underneath the waterfall. Meanwhile, Rick finds an artefact at Breach 6 that could confirm Japanese military presence on the mountain during World War II.

programme.title: MonsterQuest
programme.desc: The Tasmanian tiger was thought to have become extinct 80 years ago, but eyewitness reports and scientific research might indicate that the creature is on the verge of making a comeback.

programme.desc: Early man rubbed two sticks together and created fire. We learn to cook our food, saving vital energy. As a result, our brains expand. Armed with fire, we experiment by heating minerals to make tools allowing us to fight wars and build civilizations.

programme.title: Cities Of The Underworld
programme.desc: Chicago may be the third largest city in the USA, but it was a city built on shady dealings. Discover how it was a playground for mobsters.

programme.title: Gold Hunters: Legend Of The Superstition Mountains
programme.desc: A 200 year old treasure map leads Wayne and the team to a mysterious stone shaped like a heart with an X carved into its face; an investigation there leads to an unexpected discovery.

programme.title: Lost Gold Of World War II
programme.desc: While John and Rick work to decipher a Golden Lily map, Breach 6 reveals its first piece of treasure. Meanwhile, Levi and Geo come up with a creative solution to get past a mysterious collapse in the tunnel. And finally, while drilling towards a possible treasure vault, John and Rob make a startling discovery, and come face to face with unexpected visitors.

programme.title: MonsterQuest
programme.desc: The team embarks on a dangerous search in the Sea of Japan and along Australias Great Barrier Reef to investigate reports of a deadly jellyfish invasion.

programme.title: Lost Worlds
programme.desc: These Christian warrior monks reigned supreme for nearly 200 years. What secrets will the city of Tortosa and Jerusalems Temple Mount reveal about the holy guardians, the Knights Templar?

programme.title: The Universe
programme.desc: Explore the controlled explosion of launch, the fiery crucible of re-entry and everything in between to see why space flight is still a highly dangerous pursuit.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Investigation into whether advanced technologies such as lasers and sonic weapons are merely rediscovered tools used by advanced beings in the past.

programme.title: Breaking Mysterious
programme.desc: Who is really in control? We ride along with a member of a breakaway order of Catholic exorcists, and seek out the origins of hacker group Anonymous. Plus, is the US government creating mind-controlled super-soldiers like Jason Bourne?

programme.title: Chasing Mummies
programme.desc: Its early morning in Saqqara and Zahi is getting ready to open two sealed tombs for the first time in thousands of years, but Zoe is late again and his patience is wearing thin.

programme.desc: The San Andreas Fault runs through some of the most valuable real estate in the world. The southern section hasnt had a significant quake for over 300 years and is primed and ready for another big one.

programme.title: Brad Meltzers Lost History
programme.desc: Host Brad Meltzer and viewers are on the hunt for lost and stolen history, including Hitlers personal photo albums and James Bonds original Aston Martin. Plus, an FBI sting operation seeks a Civil War relic stained with human blood.

programme.title: In Search Of Aliens
programme.desc: Giorgio Tsoukalos heads to Peru to investigate whether the strange symbols covering its desert floor are key to proving aliens once visited Earth.

programme.title: The Curse Of Civil War Gold
programme.desc: Alex Lagina joins Kevin Dykstra and his team in their quest to find 140 million dollars in Confederate gold they believe is on the bottom of Lake Michigan and on their first day back on the lake, new evidence suggests they may have found it.

programme.title: In Search Of Aliens
programme.desc: The Loch Ness Monster is one of the worlds most enduring mysteries. Are these fantastic creatures leftover dinosaurs, mythical animals or something that travelled to Earth millions of years ago?

programme.title: Hunting Hitler
programme.desc: Digging deeper into reports about the Fourth Reich, Bob and John send the team to a rumoured weapons testing site in Germany, and a mysterious deserted island in Argentina that could have housed nuclear facilities with Nazi ties after the war.

programme.title: The Universe: Ancient Mysteries Solved
programme.desc: The Great Pyramids of Giza have eluded astronomers and archeologists for centuries. The worlds renowned Egyptologists, astronomers and engineers join forces to solve some of the long-held mysteries about the pyramids.

programme.title: Ross Kemp: Shipwreck Treasure Hunter
programme.desc: Ross prepares to explore the wreck of a sunken steam-age ship, the Iona II. The ship went down with a mystery cargo on board. Determined to solve the mystery, Ross meets with a maritime historian who has uncovered the Iona II’s shocking purpose.

programme.desc: While digging a massive steel shaft in the Money Pit area, the Lagina brothers and their team make a discovery that could help prove the legends about buried treasure to be true.

programme.title: The Unxplained With William Shatner
programme.desc: Deadly forests. Haunted houses. Mountains where visitors never return alive. Are there such things as "evil places"? Places where bad things seem to repeatedly - and inexplicably - happen?

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The shop travels back in time when a map from the late 1800s comes in; Corey spots a killer Mustang for sale; Rick takes a ride to check out a collection of transistor radios; Chum and Rick get their hands on Magic: The Gathering prototype cards.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: All engines rev when Corey flips a limited edition Dodge Demon; a vintage suit worn by the legendary Dale Earnhardt Sr sends Corey and Chumlee racing.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Puma Punku in Bolivia features some of the largest stone blocks on Earth, each carved with incredible precision. Could new advancements in technology help to solve a centuries old puzzle and offer proof of alien intervention on Earth?

programme.title: Ancient Aliens Special Presentation
programme.desc: From the furthest reaches of human history, our ancestors left curious carvings, geo-glyphs, and hieroglyphic messages for future generations to decipher. Is it possible that these relics indicate communication with extraterrestrial visitors?

programme.title: The UnXplained With William Shatner
programme.desc: The men who have served as President of the United States are celebrated as esteemed leaders. But there are many bizarre tales involving them. Could the truth behind these astonishing accounts rewrite Americas past, and perhaps reshape its future?

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: When Chum sniffs out a 1920s Baccarat bottle for Ybry perfume, is an offer crystal clear, or does it make no scents? Then, Rick takes a look at a sealed copy of the Spiderman and Venom: Maximum Carnage video game. Will this deal have his spidey senses tingling, or is the seller spinning a web of lies? Meanwhile, Corey weighs the odds on a gambling kit from the 1800s. And later, Rick and Corey take a trip to the range to scope out an autocannon used during the attack on Pearl Harbor.

programme.title: The Curse Of Oak Island

programme.desc: From the furthest reaches of human history, our ancestors left curious carvings, geo-glyphs, and hieroglyphic messages for future generations to decipher. Is it possible that these relics indicate communication with extraterrestrial visitors?

programme.title: Messy Goes to Okido
programme.desc: After accidentally causing a mini avalanche, Messy must help Lofty dig out the entrance to his cave so he can warm up again - brr!

programme.title: Strawberry Shortcakes Berry Bitty Adventures
programme.desc: The girls call in Huckleberry to help design and build a new dog park for their puppies. To Huck’s dismay he finds himself in charge of a construction crew of Berrykins, who look up to him as an expert builder. They’re unaware that he is hiding a secret: all his life, everything he tries to build falls down. When he builds a wall that doesn’t fall, he attributes his success to a crystal good luck charm he found. He later learns it belongs to Cherry, who believes that its loss is what prevents her from singing high notes on key. Huck reluctantly returns it to her.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Nana is reading Harry a bedtime fairy story, but decides it is time for Harry to go to sleep before the story is finished.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Charlie wants to go to the circus but her Mum is unable to take her.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Imagine Leo’s surprise when he realises that a piece of seaweed in his aquarium is actually a leafy seadragon! The Junior Rangers set forth to put the leafy seadragon back in Australian waters, but their mission changes course when they have to save leafy seadragons that have been washed ashore.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Everyone knows James is choosy about his work, so he’s delighted to be picked to take the Mayor and the Fat Controller to a ball in Vicarstown and promises to do all his other jobs without complaint. But James is horrified at the end of the daywhen his guard finds a tiny scratch on his paintwork! He insists on being repainted, thinking his speed and the windy weather will dry him, but leaves and twigs stick to his wet paint as he zooms along instead. James has to swallow his pride and ask Edward to do his special job. Luckily after Edward explains why James messed up, James gets another chance to shine.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Its the hottest day of the year on Sodor and the sun is causing the tracks to buckle and bend. Dowager Hatt, arrives with a present for the Fat Controller - a white pith helmet to protect him from the sun explaining that white reflects heat. Meanwhile the buckled tracks cause Whiff to lose some rubbish from his trucks and a dropped bottle causes a fire. When Belle and Flynn come to the rescue, Belle is derailed and Flynn must travel on his road wheels to put out the fire. The buckled tracks are finally repaired and Thomas suggests that they paint the new tracks white (like Sir Tophams hat) which will reflect the sun and hopefully stop the tracks buckling again.

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: Grisu and Stella are supposed to draw water from an old well but they soon face several problems: the bucket they use is holed and when they manage to get a bucket full of water, the thirsty sheeps drink all. Not mentioning Fume who doesnt see the point of watering plants when you can do some dragon training. Grisu thinks he has found the perfect solution when he gets the idea of borrowing the firefighters water pump… until Fume (always the same old tune) burns it! But Grisu is never short of ideas. He manages to build a whole aqueduct and a funny pumping device to bring water from the river to the farm!

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: Following Stellas suggestion, David and his team offer Grisu a very special day: the firefighters will involve him in their trainings. Delivering things with a drone, hitting targets with firehose water, going down the fire truck ladder while holding a bucket filled with water on ones head, navigating through a maze with lots of fun obstacles. Grisu does well in the proves, in spite of comic mishaps mainly caused by his dad. That is, until Grisu unwittingly burns the garage door switch and traps the firefighters and Fume inside, right as the siren goes off.But a firefighter never gives up!

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: After Big Nutbrown Hare shows Little Nutbrown Hare a special place where his voice echoes, he and Little Field Mouse play a game of Try to find me with Little Redwood Fox and Little Grey Squirrel. They hide in the ravine and as their voices bounce off the rocky walls, their friends have a very tricky time trying to find them.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: When Little Nutbrown Hare, Little Field Mouse and Big Nutbrown Hare go up to high meadow with Big Nutbrown Hare they get caught in the mist. It’s a little scary so they hold hands and pass the time by playing guessing games. As the mist starts to lift, they see a beautiful circle rainbow around the sun.

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: Woodsy tried to take some honey from the bees and they chased him. He got such a fright that he no longer wants to leave the burrow. His brothers and sister will do everything they can to help him over his phobia.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: When Bob and the team arrive at Chef Tattie’s fun new Milk Shake Bar, Scoop sees Chef Tattie experimenting with ingredients for his milk shakes and gets inspired. Scoop decides that he will do the same when he he helps Two-Tonne mix up the concrete for the Car Park. But the next morning, it’s soon clear that Scoop’s concrete isn’t dry. Scoop has to scrape it all off so they can start again. But Bob thinks there might be something to Scoop’s idea to make a fun car park after all and gives him some crazy but ‘proper’ materials to mix up in Dizzy.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Keen on Bob’s sardine sandwiches, Pilchard sneaks into his rucksack and hitches a ride to work at Chef Tattie’s UFO-themed revolving restaurant where she sneaks out and walks through some paint leaving a trail of green footprints. Inspired by all the talk of ‘aliens’, the Machines follow the trail. Pilchard arrives in the kitchen and goes to sleep on top of a remote control causing the restaurant to revolve at high speed. Bob saves the day by luring Pilchard off the remote control with a sardine sandwich. The team finish the restaurant and the Machines discover the truth about the ‘alien’ .

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: The Pig Twins discover a puddle full of stranded goldfish. Huckle and his pals try to solve the mystery of where they came from. It turns out they were blasted out of the park fountain when an obstruction in the drain hole suddenly got unplugged./ A mysterious message on Sgt. Murphy’s radio has Huckle and the gang baffled!

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: The Junior Rangers have a brush with a poacher as they try to return an Indian Star Tortoise to its home in the scrub forest.

programme.title: Simon
programme.desc: Simon and Gaspards parents are going out and have hired a babysitter called Marion for the evening. Simon and Gaspard arent sure about her, so shell have to win them over!

programme.title: Berry And Dolly

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: On a sunny autumn day, Berry and Dolly went into to forest to pick blueberries. Flutter, the butterfly girl, and Eddy, the potato beetle joined them as well. When Eddy saw the fruitful bushes can’t help but pick all the best fruits before the others. What’s left to do?

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: It’s December, and it’s gingerbread time! Berry and Dolly love making them. Berry’s house filled with the wonderful smell of the biscuits what the magpie immediately noticed from above. Grabbed the bowl and flew away with it. Oh my!

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: On a summer afternoon after a heavy storm Leapy, the grasshopper found an injured stranger, He immediately called for help. Berry and Dolly arrived in no time as always.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Berry and Dolly are planting sunflowers on a spring day. They take care of the flowers carefully as they emerge from the ground and grow tall. The two friends are very happy. Unfortunately the joy does not last long; someone damaged the flowers.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Berry the snailboy and Dolly the ladybird are the best friends ever. They’re having many pretty adventures in 3X13 short tales, while they make new friends and get knowledges about the world around them.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Sula have a penny each for the Surprise Machine in Padget’s shop. Sula gets the silver rhino she wanted so Bing is convinced he will get the toy he wants too. When the Surprise Machine delivers his capsule Bing is upset to discover the alien he has set his heart on is not inside.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing wants to get dizzy on the roundybout so Pando pushes him. Its not long before Bing realises that some dizzy is fun but too much dizzy is not fun at all.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing builds a house out of sofa cushions and Coco decides its perfect for a game of Big Bad Wolf. Bing enjoys being wolfie until hes not allowed into the house he built.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: It’s a hot day and Bing and Flop buy an ice lolly from Gilly the ice cream lady. Before they can eat them a frog hops into Bing’s paddling pool and they go to the rescue. By the time they return to the ice lollies all that’s left are the sticks and a plate of lolly goo.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Edna has a new business idea: restoring old furniture. When the twins Billy and Benny play with paint, they accidentally splatter Robin’s favourite cabinet. Edna is shocked, but Robin loves the result.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Frogs are staying at the Guesthouse Appleseed to collect leaves. When Tilda discovers a beautiful portrait of herself, she asks Rupert, who also received a portrait, and they search for the artist.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: The big neighbourhood race is coming up, and Snaily, who came in last place last year, dreams of winning this time. He discovers his talent on Billys skateboard, but the rules stand in his way.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse befriend a little green caterpillar but arent prepared for the changes it will undergo.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse see a beautiful rainbow. When it disappears before Big Nutbrown Hare can see it, they recreate it for him with flowers.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Field Mouse and Little Nutbrown Hare’s favourite tree falls over in a summer storm. Theyre sad until they discover the fallen tree provides an exciting new place to explore.

programme.title: Chuggington Badge Quest
programme.desc: Koko and Wilson have to load their cars with special blocks and bring them back to Vee without dropping any or leaving any behind. They think this is the easiest badge ever – until they see that the blocks are oddly shaped and won’t all fit into the cars! Eventually they realise that if they slot the blocks together to make cubes, they fit into the cars perfectly. They deliver the load to Vee and earn their badges!

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Farah was driving her dirt bike in the Philippine forest, admiring the view while doing trick before experiencing an earthquake. She then wants to investigate in hopes to save an animal that may be injured. Back in the garden, Leo is relaxing in the shade of a tree, looking up clouds. Katie then appear with her tablet and inform of an earthquake in the Philippine, and the Junior Rangers worried since Farah was on patrol there. Farah then calls up Leo and informs him of an animal she discover. After the Junior Rangers learn more about the animal with Katies computer, they agree to meet up with Farah there. Leo, Katie and Farah sees that the Philippine Eaglet is watching them from afar, and Farah warns them to not be close. The Eaglet then approaches Hero hungrily, which Hero flies in the air with its jetpack. The Junior Rangers sees that the Eaglet may not know how to fly and they decided to teach it how. Their attempt didnt work out and they later meet up with Ranger Rocky. They explain their situation, causing him to call up Ranger Joey for more information.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: On an Australian beach, Kyle builds a sandcastle until he stumbles upon a fishing net endangering a stranded Manta Ray. Simultaneously, Leo, Katie, and Hero engage in a garden frog hunt. Hero detects a croaking sound, leading them to a frog stuck in a drain pipe. As they rescue the frog, Kyle calls Leo about the trapped Manta Ray. From the computer, they learn about Manta Rays and their need for constant motion to breathe. Racing to the beach in PlatypusOne, they find Kyle tirelessly trying to keep the Manta Ray wet. Katies knowledge about Manta Rays prompts them to prioritize putting the fish back into the water before untangling the net. Utilizing the winch, they successfully pull the Manta Ray into the sea. However, their underwater celebration is disrupted when a fake shark fin alarmingly approaches them which turns out to be Ranger Rocky. He calls Ranger Joey who educates them on Manta Rays unique features, and they try to gently remove the net, freeing the Manta Ray. In the Garden, Hero playfully chases the frog, which ends up in the drainpipe revealing Hero to be the reason the frogs are in the pipe!

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: Fred has found some bowling pins he had as a child. He asks T’choupi and Nina if they want to play but they turn him down, finding the game too old. But when Dad arrives on the scene, his face lights up as soon as he sets eyes on the pins: he had this same game when he was little, and used to love playing it! Seeing their nostalgic dads playing, T’choupi and Nina realize that they too would like to join in. But their fathers are having so much fun that they don’t dare disturb them… Maybe they could make their own bowling pin game, instead…?

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: T’choupi and Nina are having fun discovering various animals’ houses. When they realize butterflies don’t have a house, they decide to build a beautiful "Butterfly Hotel!" But when the edifice is finally ready… another animal - one that is not at all to T’choupi’s liking - moves in instead!

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: When Nina asks T’choupi to accompany her to the forest for a fitness session, our little hero gets very excited… until they reach the location and there’s no fitness trail in sight! Nina laughs: that’s the funnest part about it - they’ll use the tree trunks, boulders and branches to make their own parcourse! T’choupi drags his heels as he follows Nina through the "trail." Then, when he trips and falls, he wants to call it quits… But what if he were to invent his very own fitness trail in the forest? Wouldn’t that be fun…?

programme.title: Charley Goes To School
programme.desc: Four boys want to be a tiger in the carnival of animals! A contest for best tiger is organized in order to choose between them… But their classmates think their exaggerated gestures and cries make them look more like little monsters than tigers! Which gives the teacher an idea….

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Arriving from a faraway island, Julia the little mouse moves into a new home with her mother. There she meets Sam, another young mouse whos long lived with his parents and a whole gang of brothers and sisters. They quickly become inseparable and enjoy a host of fun adventures together.

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: The rain thwarts Sam and Julias play plans for the day. Since a rain is always followed by a rainbow, why not making one in order to push the rain stop falling? But how to make a rainbow?

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Suspecting that each others life would be suits them better, Sam and Julia swap places for a few hours. But is Sams life really funnier than Julias? And her life calmer than Sams?

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Nia is delighted to be transporting an elephant to the animal park - but her passenger is less happy about it

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: When Rebecca tells James he could be a comic-book super-engine, he takes her seriously, and Rail Rocket is born.

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: After the tree in the garden falls down during a storm, the family reminisces about all their favorite memories with the tree. In a series of flashbacks we see the day they first got Gilbert and how the tree made Gilbert feel at home, the day Rosie first came home from the hospital and wouldnt stop crying until Caillou held her while sitting under the tree, and the day Mommy planted the tree while pregnant with Caillou.

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Caillou goes to a fancy new Restaurant with his family, but isreluctant to try new things - until the Chef makes him the best mealhes ever had!

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: The kids awesome sandcastle gets trampled overnight. A lone set of footprints along the beach leads to a prime suspect who claims not to have seen their sandcastle, yet hes carrying a big shell that once adorned it. As it turns out, no one touched their castle. The culprit was the rising waters of high tide. / /Huckle, Sally and Lowly discover the impossible – a set of ski tracks that run on either side of a tall tree.

programme.title: Monkey See Monkey Do
programme.desc: Monkey and parrot are playing hide and seek, Monkey is boasting of his great hiding skills when in fact Parrot finds him each time. Mole suggests going to Chameleon who is known as the hiding expert.... They are off to the forest to find the chameleon. Chameleon gives them some hiding tips and joins them in a fun game of Monkey See Monkey Do!!!

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: When filming a tourism advert about Pontypandy, Sarah gets carried away with her filming. When she climbs a mountain to get the perfect shot, she ends up stranded on a ledge. Meanwhile Elvis decides it would be a good idea to set up a souvenir stall selling jars of Pontypandy Firefighter Pickles.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: When Peter creates a wild and adventurous trail for Scoop Dooley to follow, they both end up getting lost. Meanwhile, when Radar destroys Shadow’s favourite toy, Sergeant Ravani and Sam work hard to fix it!

programme.title: Franklin And Friends
programme.desc: After Bear shows great promise at Woodland Stickball, a new game Aunt T shows the kids, Franklin takes it upon himself to act as Bear’s personal coach. But when Franklin takes the “training” too far and forgets to give Bear a chance to rest and have fun, he ends up turning his pal off the new sport – until he realizes that, above all, learning a new skill should be fun! / Franklin plans a Day with Dad, just like Fox has with his Dad, but Mr. Turtle’s busy schedule interrupts his plans. Only when Franklin learns that it is not what you’re doing but who you’re doing it with does the Day with Dad become a success.

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: Edmond lives happily with his three little badger cubs in their underground sett. One day, he falls in love with Marguerite, a fox! Marguerite and her daughter move into the family home, turning life upside-down for everyone, who now needs to find a new way to live together in harmony.Directed by: Florian Ferrier (France, 2018)

programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: Whats the best thing we can do while we wait for Christmas? Doodleboo explains to Sketchy how to draw a snowman.

programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: What is the perfect transportation to enjoy the countryside? Doodleboo explains to Sketchy how to drawn a tractor.

programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: Who has the most extraordinary costume in the savannah? Doodleboo explains to Sketchy how to draw a Zebra

programme.title: Ruff Ruff, Tweet And Dave
programme.desc: Hatty enters his best-ever carrots into the ‘Tastiest Carrot Competition’ at the Village Fair. Hoping to win prizes of their own, Ruff-Ruff, Tweet and Dave try their luck at the games stalls and each win a trophy! Hatty is disappointed when he loses out on first prize to Mr Rabbit’s prize-winning carrots, but he shows everyone that winning isn’t everything and that he can be a good loser.

programme.title: Ruff Ruff, Tweet And Dave
programme.desc: Tweet’s new friend Fluttery Butterfly introduces Ruff-Ruff, Tweet and Dave to all his fluttery butterfly friends in the Jungle. Along the way they meet a hungry caterpillar who is getting ready to sleep in his cocoon. They are surprised to learn that this clever little caterpillar with eventually grow up in the safety of his cocoon and magically transform into a beautiful butterfly, just like Fluttery!

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse discover creatures that can blend in with their surroundings and are inspired to learn just where they can blend in. Little Nutbrown hare becomes disappointed when his white fluffy tail and his dark brown ear tips give him away each time. That’s until he discovers the reeds by the river are exactly the right height and colours to camouflage him perfectly.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Big Nutbrown Hare has a lot to do today. Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse promise to help but there are so many wonderful distractions they forget their promise and let Big Nutbrown Hare down. Luckily they learn a valuable lesson from some bees and get busy to make to things right!

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Its Little Field Mouses birthday and Little Nutbrown Hare wants to give her exactly the right gift. After a moment’s thought he realises he has no idea what to give her. Big Nutbrown Hare encourages his son to think about everything he knows about his friend. He remembers she likes to look nice on her birthday, so her makes her a lovely necklace and she is delighted!

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Pando are both tired but insist on one last game of Hide and Seek before bed. Pando finds a great hiding place under the covers of Bing’s bed but by the time Bing finds him he’s fast asleep. Bing is tired too and gets upset when he thinks there’s nowhere left for him to sleep, but Flop and Padget find a way.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Sula help Amma to get lunch ready. Bing watches yummy peas and delicious carrots go into the pot, but when lunch is served theyre all mixed up together and Bing doesnt like it.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing falls in love with a lost dog he and Flop find in the park and decides he wants to keep her. When the owner turns up Bing is very upset when it comes to saying goodbye to his new friend.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: When the children make Eggy heads with eggs and cress seeds, Bing gets impatient and wants his cress to grow quicker so he decides to give Eggy lots of water with the garden hose.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: The bunny gets jealous when Sula gives Pando more attention on a playdate. He tries to gain some for himself and ends up being pushed, so Amma show them how to get rid of the anger

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Shaun invites his friends to Sand Island during the summer heatwave. Christopher and Chloe, the two canaries, ferry the friends over. Bubble, Balthazar, Dolly, Stanley, Berry, Flutter, and Shaun build sand houses. Balthazar accidentally knocks down Bubble the flower beetles house. Suddenly, a summer shower begins and washes away all the sand houses. They stand sadly around their ruined creations and decide to build a large drip sandcastle together. Side by side, they build drip towers, construct castle walls, and decorate the tops with sand balls. The day passes joyfully, and by the evening, when the canaries come to pick them up, magnificent drip towers stand tall on the island.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: At the end of summer, the Star Girl visits her friends. She rarely comes because her star-shaped house is in the sky. They spend a day together, and when night falls, the Star Girl bids everyone farewell. She can’t speak, but she plays the harp beautifully. The music will lift her house into the sky. However, this time one of the harp strings comes loose, and the house doesn’t rise. The Wind blows the string out of her hand, and she can’t catch it.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: The Centipedes apple tree hasn’t had any fruit for many years. He asks Berry for help, who carefully tends to the tree. At the beginning of summer, apples finally appear, and the Centipede is so happy that he invites his distant relative, the Millipede, for a visit. However, the Millipede falls ill and can’t come. The Centipede then invites his friends to a big apple party. When they arrive, they pretend that the Millipede was there, but it turns out that it was just his friends in costume.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: The Cave Spider and the tiny Spiderling are good friends, and one summer day they are walking on the mountaintop. Spiderling blows a dandelion at the Cave Spider, who falls and gets injured. Spiderling immediately seeks help from Doctor Owl, who determines that the Cave Spiders legs are bruised and prescribes two weeks of rest. Berry, Dolly, Stanley, and Balthazar help the Cave Spider get home. Dolly suggests they sew a large canopy so the Cave Spider can watch the ants end-of-summer fireworks from the air. Flutter, Leapy, Zephyr, and the others make the canopy, and on the night of the fireworks, they lift the Cave Spider up so he can enjoy the view from above.

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: All the balls at Farmer Patrick Pigs new mini putt are disappearing. After much investigation Huckle and the gang track the missing balls to Patricks record breaking ‘egg laying’ chicken. / When the gold coins Mr Fix It finds on the beach disappear, Huckle, Lowly and Sally set out to find out where they went.

programme.title: Monkey See Monkey Do
programme.desc: Parrot is trying to fall asleep but monkey continuously disturbs him. Mole appears and tells them that the sounds of the ocean are known to having a calming effect. They fly to the ocean and bump into what appears to be an island, but is soon revealed as an opera singing whale on her way to choir practice. They dive after her and invite her to play Monkey See Monkey Do!

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: When Miss Pawdry stows away on a Pioneer camping trip, she leads Mandy and the rest of the Pioneers into the forest and gets them all lost.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: When Peter lets Nipper off his lead after promising not to, Nipper runs away. Peter tries to get Nipper back but accidentally scares the dog off the edge of a cliff.

programme.title: Kipper
programme.desc: It’s Jake’s birthday and everyone seems to have forgotten. He wishes for a big birthday party with all his friends. Kipper arrives – but he just wants to take Jake to the park. Luckily Kipper can’t keep a secret and Jake’s wish comes true.

programme.title: Kipper
programme.desc: There’s a thump on Kipper’s front door. When he opens it, there’s a ball. But it’s not an ordinary ball as Kipper soon finds out – it seems to have a life of its own, and Arnold has great fun with it when no-one is looking.

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: When Fred gives his daughter Nina a little badge, officially recognizing her as a "farmer,"Tchoupi gets envious: he wants a "farmer badge" too! Nina warns him: it’s not that easy, but Tchoupi believes he can do it and begins learning the ropes in earnest, following his friend’s instructions. He does pretty well with it… until the greedy goat escapes from her pen and makes a beeline for the large vegetable garden! Poor Tchoupi: doesn’t look like he’ll be getting that badge any time soon…!

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: T’choupi and Nina are super excited about going running in the woods! But they must wait for Fanni to wake up from her nap before heading out… When the nap drags on, the parents suggest they take Fanni to the forest in her stroller so that she can continue to sleep. However, this means everyone must remain silent during the excursion so as not to wake the baby: Shhhhhh!... Luckily, it ends up being a great opportunity to discover all the amazing sounds the forest has to offer!

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: The Treasure Cupboard: Julia wonders why her mum stores the gifts in the closet while Sams mum displays his in the living room. (S1, ep 15)

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Sam feels a little invaded by the birth of three babies at home. But Julia, who always dreamt of having brothers and sisters, finds the occasion to play doll. How to spend their afternoon together?

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Tilda Appleseed is overwhelmed by the many tasks in her guesthouse. But when she observes calm Snaily, she realizes that she can accomplish everything in a relaxed manner and one step at a time.

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: Today its Mischief Day, the Triplets favorite day. This year they will be the best at doing mischiefs. They even have the greatest of ideas: to create an encyclopedia of all the pranks they know of. The children will soon find out that their Grandfather was the best pranker in the family when he was young. Well, second best, beause Mommy has a few tricks up her sleeve too. The encyclopedia will be full soon enough. And there might even be a part about Totos jokes.

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: Love Monster finds it difficult when everyone has to do things the opposite way around.

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: Edmond lives happily with his three little badger cubs in their underground sett. One day, he falls in love with Marguerite, a fox! Marguerite and her daughter move into the family home, turning life upside-down for everyone, who now needs to find a new way to live together in harmony.Directed by: Florian Ferrier (France, 2018)

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: After seeing him help Rosie with her toy, Mommy refers to Caillou as a "Kindness Superhero" which sends his imagination into overdrive. For the rest of the day "Super Caillou" and his sidekick "Super Gilbert" save an imaginary beach from Sharks and sunburn, whilst also making everyone in the real worlds day in the garden a little nicer, too.

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Caillou and his scout troop have been challenged to receive theirkindness badge this week! To do so, they must be kind to someone intheir community, look for acts of kindness in their lives, and, mostimportantly, be kind to themselves. Caillou is determined to finish histasks before Clementine!

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Philip spots Toby and assumes that he is a diesel boxcab just like him. Convinced that they will become best friends, Philip rushes up to introduce himself, but Toby finds him rather overwhelming. Philip is very persistent and manages to get Toby to have a race with him, but Toby doesn’t like it very much. Philip gets upset and thinks Toby doesn’t like him, but with a little help he eventually learns that you can be friends with someone who doesn’t like the same things you like.

programme.title: Chuggington
programme.desc: Sub-zero temperatures are causing problems for the chuggers. The docks are covered by thick fog and the haulers can’t get out with their deliveries on the treacherous tracks. It also means that no cargo ships will be able to dock today. Jackman has the Chug Patrollers out early gritting the tracks. When the Working Wheels Yard runs out of diesel, Vee declares an emergency and all diesel engines are grounded. The only place that still has a supply of diesel is the docks.

programme.title: Chuggington
programme.desc: The chuggineers have a busy day ahead. They need to repair the damage caused by a fire at the lighthouse, and fix some track out near the river. Fletch is keen to impress Zack and show him how responsible he is, so he offers to take care of the work at the lighthouse, while the others fix the track - but he soon discovers that being in charge is hard. He wastes valuable time on things that shouldn’t concern him, and then forgets to pick up the hook he needs for the crane. Running out of time, he rushes and carelessly drops the lighthouse roof into the sea.

programme.title: Charley Goes To School
programme.desc: Four boys want to be a tiger in the carnival of animals! A contest for best tiger is organized in order to choose between them… But their classmates think their exaggerated gestures and cries make them look more like little monsters than tigers! Which gives the teacher an idea….

programme.title: Ruff Ruff, Tweet And Dave
programme.desc: Ruff-Ruff, Tweet and Dave learn all the colours of the rainbow, by naming and matching colours in Hatty’s garden.

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: When he finds out that today is Nina’s birthday, T’choupi is eager to give her a surprise! And what could be better than have Dad bake one of his yummy cakes?! But to pull it off, they’re going to have to collect eggs and pick strawberries in the hamlet without Nina noticing. And given how eager she is to play with T’choupi, this is no easy feat! When she notices T’choupi is acting mysterious and distant all of a sudden, she even gets a bit annoyed, not to say offended…

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Kai was enjoying his time by the river, playing with a drone and conducting experiments with his unique smelling bombs. After a brief test that resulted in the area being engulfed in a green cloud, Kai noticed a peculiar creature emitting a peppery scent, prompting him to contact the Junior Rangers for assistance. Meanwhile, in the garden, Leo and Katie engaged in a friendly competition, trying to determine whether their dog, Hero, would show more interest in his toy or a delicious treat. However, when they called Hero to make his choice, he disregarded both options. Suddenly, Leo received a call from Kai, who informed them about the mysterious creature he had encountered. Utilizing Katies computer, they identified it as a Giant Japanese Salamander. Upon learning that the salamander was trapped and potentially in danger, the Junior Rangers hurried to Kais location. Once there, they collaborated to move a rock, enabling the salamander to escape. However, they noticed that one of its feet had become detached. Concerned for the salamanders well-being, they embarked on a mission to find the missing limb. Fortunately, they encountered Ranger Rocky, who happened to be nearby. They explained the situation, leading Ranger Rocky to contact his colleague, Ranger Joey, for additional assistance. Ranger Joey enlightened them about the salamanders ability to regenerate its legs, relieving everyones worries about its condition.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Leapy, the grasshopper girl, gets paint on her hair while painting her house in the spring. She can’t wash it off, so Zephyr, the dragonfly, offers to cut her hair. Leapy is very sad when she sees herself in the mirror; she doesn’t like her new hairstyle. At Zephyrs suggestion, they show the others, but only Dolly notices the change and compliments her. Later, they hold a hairstyle day, where everyone creates special hairstyles for themselves. Leapy happily finishes painting her house and invites her friends to a spring feast.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Stanleys birthday is approaching, and he becomes very curious and can’t wait to find out what gift he will receive from Dolly. He peeks into the ladybird girls drawer. The next day, he tells Balthazar that he knows what his gift will be. On his birthday, the friends gather and wish Stanley a happy birthday. Flutter presents the cake, they sing, and then Stanley blows out the candles and cuts the cake. Stanley receives many nice gifts, including a bowling set from Dolly. Stanley admits that he peeked into the ladybird girls drawer because he was curious about his gift.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Shaun invites his friends to Sand Island during the summer heatwave. Christopher and Chloe, the two canaries, ferry the friends over. Bubble, Balthazar, Dolly, Stanley, Berry, Flutter, and Shaun build sand houses. Balthazar accidentally knocks down Bubble the flower beetles house. Suddenly, a summer shower begins and washes away all the sand houses. They stand sadly around their ruined creations and decide to build a large drip sandcastle together. Side by side, they build drip towers, construct castle walls, and decorate the tops with sand balls. The day passes joyfully, and by the evening, when the canaries come to pick them up, magnificent drip towers stand tall on the island.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: At the end of summer, the Star Girl visits her friends. She rarely comes because her star-shaped house is in the sky. They spend a day together, and when night falls, the Star Girl bids everyone farewell. She can’t speak, but she plays the harp beautifully. The music will lift her house into the sky. However, this time one of the harp strings comes loose, and the house doesn’t rise. The Wind blows the string out of her hand, and she can’t catch it.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: The Centipedes apple tree hasn’t had any fruit for many years. He asks Berry for help, who carefully tends to the tree. At the beginning of summer, apples finally appear, and the Centipede is so happy that he invites his distant relative, the Millipede, for a visit. However, the Millipede falls ill and can’t come. The Centipede then invites his friends to a big apple party. When they arrive, they pretend that the Millipede was there, but it turns out that it was just his friends in costume.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Pando discover a new climbing frame at the playground. It’s got climbing bits, tippy bits and even a wobbly bridge. But when Bing gets to the top of the slide it’s too scary for him to go down. Bing watches Pando to see how he does it, then he helps Hoppity Voosh to go down. When Hoppity likes it Bing has a go too.

programme.title: Bing Bunny

programme.title: Bing Bunny - Shorts and characters

programme.title: Simon
programme.desc: Gaspard and Simon are playing “knights”. For costumes, their father has made them really cool shields. But without horses, playing “knights” is a whole lot less fun! No need to ask dad for help, Simon is going to make them himself. Awesome, but still, Gaspard finds that Simon isn’t quite as talented as Dad. Simon is going to prove him wrong and show his brother he can do everything that Dad can do: he vacuums like him, well, almost…Gaspard is still unconvinced. Simon decides to prove it by preparing dinner like Dad! His “very original” recipe surprises his parents a bit but Gaspard thinks it’s delicious! The parents go along with the game and even let Simon tuck them into bed, just like Dad does! But if Simon puts his parents to bed, then who’s going to put him to bed?!?!

programme.desc: Martis wants to leave, like his older brothers before him. Scoutbadger says he would like to go along too. The boys will find out that they are not yet quite big enough to play the adult.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: The cool Autumn breeze isn’t enough to deter Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse from going out to find what special experiences the day might bring. However, with the weather and wind constantly changing, it’s very hard for the friends continue playing any one game. Will the strange weather spoil their fun, or will it bring them a special experience after all?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Among the newly fallen Autumn leaves Little Nutbrown Hare finds a very peculiar little, hairy, green… ‘something’. Intrigued by what it might be Little Nutbrown Hare asks all his friends, but they all have different answers! It is certainly a very useful ‘something’, great for back scratching and games but it takes Little Grey Squirrel to solve the mystery.

After a crazy expedition and many splashes, it is Moms turn to enjoy a nice relaxing bath. But not for long...because she soon finds out that the Triplets have replaced the bubble bath with dish soap!

So when she gets to spend the afternoon with the Triplets, she is as happy as can be and already pictures herself marrying the little boy and having many kids with him. Poet and Girl have a great time teasing their brother and Turbulent is quite upset "We are not in love!" But the next day, the bakery is covered in hearts!

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: As Kyle was kayaking near the shoreline to test his speed, he stumble upon a plastic bottle drifting in the water. He picks it up and notice a strange animal inside of it. Back in the garden, Leo And Katie are playing a guessing game. Leo sees a ladybug and have Katie guess it, which she has a hard time answering. Hero, their dog, appears and chase away the ladybug from the flower, causing Leo to lose their game because he cant show it to Katie. Leo then receives a call from Kyle who show him of the fascinating animal. After learning more information on Katies computer, the Junior Rangers agree to meetup with Kyle there to help return the animal to its habitat. Once arriving there, Kyle shows the Blue Sea Dragon to the Junior Rangers. Katie and Leo try looking for a suitable to relocate the animal with Katies tablet, unknowingly seeing that Kyle is attempting to open the bottle to free the animal. Kyle struggle hard and opens it, causing the bottle to go overboard. Leo And Katie looks back and realize the bottle isnt there. Suddenly, Ranger Rocky appear with the bottle, advising them not to litter. Kyle explains himself that he wasnt littering, but was freeing the animal. They see that the animal isnt inside the bottle anymore. The Junior Rangers lost the animal, which Ranger Rocky thinks its a good time to call for Ranger Joey with some valuable information.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: As Zari scoops up water into her bucket to fill onto her sandcastles moat, she accidentally picks up a lost clown fish in the process. Back in the garden, Leo and Katie are playing a try not to laugh challenge, where the opposing side try to make the other person laugh with bad jokes. Katie laughs at a scene of Hero being goofy, which Leo counts as him winning. Leo then receives a call from Zari, informing him of the animal she discovers. After Katie and Leo learn more about the animal on Katies computer, they agree to meet up with Zari to return it to its habitat. Once in the ocean, they try swimming with it and let it go free, but this attracts the attention of a stingray. Leo saves the clownfish and put it back inside the bucket. They then meet up with Ranger Rocky, where they share their issue with the situation. Ranger Rocky calls up Ranger Joey, the ranger with the helpful information. After Ranger Joey debrief them of helpful info, Ranger Rocky excuse himself away as he has to deal with a school of dolphin. The Junior Rangers then finally found the sea anemone and returns the clownfish to its home. The day is safe and they return home. Back in the garden, Katie manages to make Leo laughs with a joke she comes up with.

But when they arrive they find that Johnny Snowman has run out of snow! Determined to get their treats, they take the wagon to gather fresh snow from the top of Kitty-Katskill Mountain. They select the sweetest crunchiest snow and head home. But they accidentally start an avalanche and find themselves being chased by a giant snowball. Oswald saves the day by guiding the snowball into the Snowcone Shop and everyone celebrates - with lots of snow cones!

Scoop takes a burning bin to the beach where it falls on the kiosk roof. Scoop saves the kiosk by scooping sand onto the roof.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Mayor Madison has commissioned a skate park so that the Spring City Rockets can enter an online action sports video. As Bob and the team set to work building it, Scoop, Muck and Lofty ask Leo if he can skate. Although he’s never actually set foot on a board, Leo gets swept up in the moment and boasts that he’s an amazing skateboarder, nicknamed “Lightning Leo”. When Brandon announces that they need one more rider to join them in the video (competition rules) Dizzy is keen to have a go, demonstrating her skill on four wheels. But the machines insist Lightning Leo should be in it... and suddenly Leo finds himself slated for a “Battle of the Boards” contest with Dizzy once the skate park has been completed. He dashes off to buy a skateboard kit (including an action camera), and returns to the park to practice.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You

programme.title: Messy Goes to Okido
programme.desc: Everyone in Okido is feeling very tired. Messy tries to help by adding extra super beans to Farmer Fuddles new recipe, but now everyone has far too much energy! How can Messy help them burn it off so Okido City can go back to normal?

programme.title: Dietrich Fischer-Dieskau : Dernières paroles
programme.desc: The great German baritone Dietrich Fischer-Dieskau was greatly admired for his interpretive insight, note-perfect control of the tonal qualities, and shadings of color in his voice, for exceptional rhythmic sense and impeccable diction. His reputation as a lieder singer is so high – he had a repertoire of more than 3.000 songs – that it is easy to forget his extensive list of operatic roles. In this conversation Fischer-Dieskau reveals for the last time on camera the secrets of his outstanding career. His ‘Last Words’ provide a deep insight into the extraordinary artistic life of one of the most famous and prolific lieder singers of our time. Dietrich Fischer-Dieskau died in May 2012 at the age of 86.Subtitles available for this program with your remote control

programme.title: Rachmaninov revisited
programme.desc: Celebrated in his day not only as a great composer, Sergei Rachmaninov was also admired as an outstanding pianist who was a peerless interpreter of his own works including the piano concerti and the Rhapsody on a Theme by Paganini.It is well known that he was in effect the sole pianist capable of performing his most demanding Third Piano Concerto and his performances and recording of the concerto came to be considered as the definitive ones. The relationship between performance, interpretation, and Rachmaninov’s own life is addressed in this film by young pianists. They explore the evolution of interpretation over the past few decades with brief excerpts of recordings by Rachmaninov as contrasted with contemporary performances by today’s well-known young pianists as they comment on the differences (or similarities) of their approach.Subtitles available for this program with your remote control

programme.title: The Lost Paradise, a portrait of Arvo Part
programme.desc: He is the most performed contemporary composer in the world. Nevertheless, he also rarely ventures out in public, keeps quiet about his music, feels at home in the forests of Estonia and generates therewith – perhaps involuntarily – the impression of a recluse, which is attributed to him again and again: Arvo Part.The Estonian composer, who will celebrate his 90th birthday on September 11, 2025, verily exudes even solely by his appearance an aura of a mystic or an ascetic. He himself says: “I am no prophet, no cardinal, not a monk, not even a vegetarian.” But he is without a doubt a devout man, who has been a member of the Russian Orthodox Church since 1970, and under pressure from the Soviet apparatus of power was forced to leave his native Estonia in 1980. Via Vienna he arrived in Berlin, which for the next 30 years would become his second home and also the starting point for his international career.“The Lost Paradise” is the first international documentary about Arvo Part. It is quite an astonishment that such a shy artist has given his consent to be accompanied by a camera for an entire year: In his native Estonia, travelling to Germany, Italy, and Japan, where Part received the Praemium Imperiale, the world’s most prestigious award in the field of music, in October 2014.The film is framed by the identically named stage production “Adam’s Passion,” featuring three key works by Arvo Part, which American director Robert Wilson brought to the stage in May 2015 in a former submarine factory, the “Noblessner Foundry” in Tallinn.
